website_summaries.verdict: A simple solution for carrying your surfboard or paddleboard on a car without a roof rack.
pros: Soft pads fit right onto the roof of a vehicle without damaging the surface
Can carry other types of luggage and flotation devices up to 165 lb
cons: Rack straps allow moisture and rain to get inside the interior of a car through the door seals

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy, and worth it
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to use for short trips. My electric vehicles don't hold 4 x 8 sheets of plywood, so I had to buy something to transport lumber from our local hardware store. I didn't want to buy anything exotic or difficult to put on, since it's light use and short trips. This soft roof rack did the trick. Very easy to install and adjust. No slippage during a 5 mile drive. Fastest speed was about 50mph, and the unit had no problems (although the straps I used to hold the plywood in place starting "singing" around 40mph.
customer_reviews.author: Pixel_dude

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I got my 2 kayak from walmart and carry with it. I did not drive more than 40mph but pad did its job..it is pretty good and cheap solution for no roof rack cars..I have 17 fiesta and worked pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Roshan Bahmani

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Work on my Acura TL and position so I can avoid the sunroof. I'm happy with the quality and ease of use. I've transported a single and tandem kayak, one at a time, with no issue. I strap over the top and through the doors then attach the front and back to keepers under the hood and trunk.
customer_reviews.author: AtomC

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and pops in trunk when not in use; secure and no wind drag/noise.
customer_reviews.text: So great! I haul my ocean kayak on car roof effortlessly. And it won't be stolen while I'm gone, as it pops off and is locked inside car in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hanlin

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive product to move a kayak or other object with a small car
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice and simple to use. The only thing you have to deal with is the tightened strap going across the inside of the car by the headliner. It can take a little time to get used to as your head might bump up against it when you get in and out of the car or when you drive. I do highly recommend this product as a great alternative to buying a roof rack.
customer_reviews.author: M. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Clasps came undone, surfboard killed a Prius
customer_reviews.text: The clasps that hold the straps in place were not safe at all. My surfboard seemed to be strapped onto my roof just fine, but I was driving down the freeway and all of a sudden the straps came undone, ripped out from my door frame, and my surfboard went flying off my roof and onto the freeway. The pads were still attached to the board when I saw it flying in the air in my rear view mirror. I’m surprised it didn’t kill anyone. This was the scariest moment of my life. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekkah

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, lightweight, easy to manage
customer_reviews.text: I love how light and easy the racks are. Won’t scrath car and as a 5’2” Girl i had no problem setting it up. Would have given them the full 5 star but I wish it came with ratchet straps, the kind that you pump back and forth instead of losing straps. It held tight even going 75 on a highway but it would feel even better knowing the ratchet straps click and hold each time you engage it. Easy enough to purchase if and when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly to strap skis to the top of the car! Sturdy, easy to install, price was right!
customer_reviews.author: sorensene

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, possibly dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: The first time we took the soft racks out of the box and tried to fit them on the car, the metal clasp broke on one of the straps. This wasn't just annoying (we couldn't surf that day) it was also dangerous (what if the clasp went when we were driving down the freeway? It's the only thing keeping one of the pads secured to the top of the car). I've used surf straps with the same kind of metal clasp (with teeth) for months daily and they have never once broken under that amount of use. We're now returning the pads and are going to our local surf shop for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: These racks are great.
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these racks on a rental car to transport 2 paddle boards around while I’m on vacation for a few weeks in the Keys. They work great. Absolutely no complaints. I had tried other soft racks years ago and these work much better. Just one reminder for anyone else who buys them. You don’t want to leave soft racks on the car in the rain when not in use because the straps help wick water into the car cabin. Oops....
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Glavin

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it simple.
customer_reviews.text: A low tech solution to a low tech problem. Strap it on your car, strap things to it, what could be more simple? I'm using it for a couple of kayaks but it could be used for nearly anything that the straps will reach around (within reason). Use your head and take into consideration the speed and distance that you will be traveling. Amazon has available, a number of other anchoring devices that can be used in conjunction with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Busters dad

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Bought these soft tops for a Toyota SUV. I am not a super technical person, and they work fabulously. Was surprised. Very good value. Serve my purpose and easy to use/store. Bought mine almost 2 years ago. Still in excellent condition. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Annjulie

customer_reviews.title: So glad I tried them
customer_reviews.text: For the price difference in renting the skis for a family of four on the mountain it was like they were free and then some We hadn't been skiing in years and renting skis on the mountain is ridiculous found a great ski rental shop down the mountain very easy to work with so very glad these worked I would recommend them to anyone and we have a car
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Better design soft rack
customer_reviews.text: I like this strap arrangement more than the blocksurf single board soft rack because it keeps the strap connecting to the car independent of the strap holding down the boards (blocksurf double keeps the straps independent, but is very much side by side rather than a single big pad). It's also a bit wider and beefier so it can be used for transporting a SUP or other large items
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Product is flimsy and not as described
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. I bought this to transport my 40 pound paddle board and it didn’t work. I am fortunate that the board didn’t fly off my roof. Description says it can hold 165 pounds but the straps are very thin. I wouldn’t recommend this and will be asking for my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Margs36

customer_reviews.title: Saved a lot of money!
customer_reviews.text: I need handlebars rarely and I did not want 1) spend around $1000 on Thule; 2) spoil the outfit of my brand new Honda Accord. So, these guys are time and money savers: easy to (dis)assemble, carry almost anything. For sure, I would not recommend using the carrier on long distances, carrying something heavy on a high speed, but they are way good for all other purposes! 4 of 5 stars: I would recommend to secure metal rings on the carriers some how: this is to easy to damage windows of your car during installation.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Barabanoff

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not great
customer_reviews.text: I received the product and used it a few days later to strap my paddle board to the top of my Prius. It was relatively easy to install and use, however, I was not happy with the quality of the product. The straps seemed to stretch a little when I was securing my board and even tho it held my board for that one trip I wasn't comfortable that it would last long so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: E. West

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for those with small cars.
customer_reviews.text: So far these seem to be a great solution for those who don't have rack on the top of their car. Was easy to install and is much better compared to those foam blocks you see sometimes. It seems well made and will hopefully last for years to come. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole W

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great temporary solution. I wouldn't purchase this if you will be using them often for far trips, but it is definitely nice to have. I don't trust using the loops that you are suppose to hook to. They look like they might rip off, so I just strap inside the car. When installed, they don't slide around at all and provide a good padding for whatever you're transporting.
customer_reviews.author: pan

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit
customer_reviews.text: The straps aren't long enough to meet in the center of my jeep. Can't return product.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Horn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value vs. traditional cross-bars!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing value compared to traditional cross-bars. I've already used it to carry windsurfing equipment and large heavy materials - you'll be amazed at how easy it is to install on practically any vehicle and how much stuff you can pile on safely.
customer_reviews.author: SelectiveBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great for short rides, but get the inside of you car soaked if it rains.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha F.

customer_reviews.title: So far so great! Exactly what I needed for my sedan!
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a couple months now, I use them on my 2018 Altima to travel with my iSUP (inflatable paddleboard). So far I’ve used it three times and it’s holding up great, no signs on wear yet, and it’s not very noisy as long at there’s no twist in the straps. It could easily hold a second paddleboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best. I have a 2005 Toyota Corolla and I can put my paddle board on my car with ease. By far my best purchase. Everyone that sees them things they are amazing. Very simple and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Paper Doll

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mazda’s and Kayaks
customer_reviews.text: Have two sets since cars don’t have a hard rack. Loaded kayak perfectly and adds good height to protect the cars roof. The cables it comes with to tie things down are solid and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: BrokenR0B0

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: We used these to haul our skis from Texas to New Mexico on my Altima. Worked well, especially for the price. One trip a year is not worth me purchasing an expensive rack for my car.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pendergrass

customer_reviews.title: Saved my trip!
customer_reviews.text: This product is sufficient. I have a Hyundai Accent and attached two snowboards to the device. It took a couple of tries before securing it down correctly. It also didn't include clear directions, but thank goodness I'm good at problem solving. It was an inexpensive way to travel around with our boards.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Prangley

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product. I was able to strap on my paddle board quickly and drive 60MPH with no problems lol why I didn't give it a 5 star is bc the straps are awkward in the car and after a couple days loosen a little bit. But for the price they are great! 👍
customer_reviews.author: Amy Wallace

customer_reviews.title: not ideal for ski/snowboarders
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this product for anyone looking for a cheap solution to transport skis or snowboards. the pads simply aren't tall enough to provide enough clearance for snowboards or skis with bindings. if they were two or three inches thicker, they would be able to accommodate stacked skis, but the current design means you have to fasten each ski independently.
customer_reviews.author: sljuka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small car
customer_reviews.text: This soft rack helped me carry two rental 9ft foam boards on top of my Prius. Works with no problem. Easy installation. A tons of padding.
customer_reviews.author: Haylee Wu

customer_reviews.title: Great Soft roof rack!
customer_reviews.text: It does the job it says it will do. I use these to put a 12' board on my mustang. It is quite a sight, but the board stays in place. I have had no visible scratches or car deformities after multiple uses on my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: SicEmBears

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! So easy to install now I can take my Kayak anywhere with out spending 1,000.00 on a permanent roof rack. The only change I would make is to add the cranking ratchets. Would have made securing them easier.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a family ski trip and am very happy with our purchase. Great value for the price. We were able to fit three sets of skis, a snow board, and all our poles. There is some extra wind noise and we did have small amounts of water seep through the doors during heavy rain on our 9 hour trip; however, this was a good purchase for us since we only ski a few times a year at most.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W.

customer_reviews.title: Getting water inside the car when raining
customer_reviews.text: Well i have to change my review because I’ve been getting issues with these racks getting water inside my car when is raining. Otherwise they work good.
customer_reviews.author: Lenin R.

customer_reviews.title: For light loads only
customer_reviews.text: While these were a great value and would be great for something lightweight like a surfboard, they are not appropriate for use on a coupe with anything remotely heavy. I tried to use these for a fishing kayak (~70 pounds) on my mustang. Because none of the weight is over the door beams it bowed and warped my roof as soon as I tried to strap it down.
customer_reviews.author: k.curtis

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive alternative
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use. Can be removed from car and stored in trunk then easily reattached. I use it for a kayak that I only need to move a few blocks to the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Whoever invented these is a genius.
customer_reviews.text: These are like pool noodles with a casing, instead of using ropes. Much more stable, too, and more affordable than installing roof racks. Since we’ll only use them a couple of years, these are the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J. Bordon

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The product was not what I expected. Although the quality was decent, the instructions looked to be written by a child. Any pre-search I had done stated the the item could be adjusted to fit item of all sizes by adjusting the strap through the need loops. Not so. And as I said, the instructions were useless
customer_reviews.author: John T Ingato

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Tried this out as soon as we received it with my wife's 10" long Paddleboard. Easy to install and on a test drive seemed very stable. Look forward to driving to the lake as soon as the weather warms up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Azpete

customer_reviews.title: Great for any car type!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install and very sturdy. Great for my kayak and small car!
customer_reviews.author: Ami Turner

customer_reviews.title: Best re-useable racks
customer_reviews.text: I used these to store snowboards on top of my car. They were awesome! I felt both boards were secure with no damage to my car. They were super quick and easy to install. I would suggest removing after each use. If the straps get saturated with liquid, it will leak into the car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great !
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to put together, take off, and store. Helps to have some muscle to tighten, otherwise, great !
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good alternative if you can’t afford a “real” roof rack. Only thing I would say is you might need to get better straps. But definitely cool!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are not clear
customer_reviews.text: I may not have this attached correctly. The instructions were very clear on how to strap the board to the rack once the rack is installed. I can hear a very loud noise when I drive over about 35 mph. It sounds like all my windows are down. I’m not sure if that’s normal or if I don’t have it installed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an inexpensive way to transport my kayak and bought these. I have driven 55 mph and did not have an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Buy them is you want to safe time and worry less
customer_reviews.text: This makes kayaking so much effing easier than the flimsy ones. I love them !
customer_reviews.author: MNGML

customer_reviews.title: Worth it ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it today for a 6 hour road trip for my kayak and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Too late
customer_reviews.text: Great item but I could use it it was shipped to late and no longer needed w
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Good universal kayak rack
customer_reviews.text: Install is easy and can be done in minutes. Was able to mount a 12 foot fishing kayak to my two door car.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy williams

customer_reviews.title: Paddle Board Easy transport
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. No issues here. When it rains water will travel inside the car so don't transport when it rains Not the products fault.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Frostad

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended, Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it perfect if you dont have racks on car or SUV!! Didnt disappoint. Some noise but who cares when you are cruising and Jammin💯✌
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Good Jeep roof rack idea
customer_reviews.text: Great low cost ski rack for my Jeep. Will let you know how it goes when the snow flys
customer_reviews.author: stephenkrockta

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my Honda Civic to carry my kayak. Set up and kayak loading for me alone takes about 10 minutes and even less to unload and breakdown. Great affordable option for those who don’t have a roof rack or crossbars
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Lost surfboard because of this
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product i only used it twice and metal Piece broke off while driving causing my surfboard to fly off hood of the car and losing my surfboard. I highly recommend to not use this.
customer_reviews.author: eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality! Three times used and broke
customer_reviews.text: I used just three times and the seam of the ribbon broke and loosened from the buckle. Really very dangerous! I would like to return if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to tighten these but they worked well with transportation with two 7 foot surf boards.
customer_reviews.author: Sevin

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I only drove it a few miles at 30mph but it seemed pretty sturdy. Super easy to throw on my roof and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Great product - big thick pads
customer_reviews.text: Great product - big thick pads. Just got back from a 1500 mile road trip with a 9’ long board and these did great. No damage or scuffs to the car. The pads came with some good tie down straps as well. The board and pads were fine at highway speeds. Had little to no loud wind noise or vibrations. Occasionally developed a few buzzing sounds from the tie downs with cross winds or with how I ran the straps but just stopped and adjusted the straps and that always cured it. Very happy - good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Rokengo7

customer_reviews.title: Boards flew off the roof....
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had my surfboards on my car pretty tight, but the straps came undone on the freeway. This could have been a monumentally costly incident if they had hit another car or a biker. If you buy this rack, you had better live somewhere very rural, or be prepared to hold the straps yourself while you drive to keep it from coming loose.
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to use and set up and kept everything secure
customer_reviews.text: I used this rack to haul my skis from NYC to Vermont and didn't have one problem. It was easy to use and set up and kept everything secure. .
customer_reviews.author: NJG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my surfboards
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Straps do have to go through the inside of your vehicle, but that is a very minor issue, if one at all. Overall I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit on a minivan.
customer_reviews.text: The product seemed fine enough; good price, good quality but I had to return it because it was way too small for our Honda Odyssey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works good for my longboard. I can go 60 mph without problem. Board shakes, but stays tight.
customer_reviews.author: Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought these pads for my 10’5 paddle board and do a fine job! No rack on my car so I bought 2 more straps separately for precaution and I had no problems just lots of noise from straps !
customer_reviews.author: andreina27

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: This roof is very nice. I used it last weekend and found it very good. There is very little noise when driving and it was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: fits BMW E70 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: easy to mount. tried on highway with a paddle board on top at 70mph and was very safe.
customer_reviews.author: Mateo

customer_reviews.title: Cooties
customer_reviews.text: Tightened down the straps all the way and the stitching broke on one part
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: No complaints here!
customer_reviews.text: I love these they serve the purpose and are simple and effective
customer_reviews.author: Kim C.

customer_reviews.title: The best is this
customer_reviews.text: Quality product! soport more weight than the others and perfect for save your surf stuff, kayak, and your car! I looked all the products and i choose this and im very Happy , i will recomended 100%
customer_reviews.author: Agustín chirulnicoff

customer_reviews.title: Works with snow skis
customer_reviews.text: I used it for snow skis and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ekizian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, and gets the job done. I have an 11' paddle board and a 6' fish, using the racks for them separately or together has been easy and safe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Car roof rack really works
customer_reviews.text: Does what I needed it to do, no problem supporting my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos V

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works great for putting my kayak on my Honda Fit a few times a week.
customer_reviews.author: MerReadsBooks

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for small water toys.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for paddle boards, surf boards, and smaller kayaks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy N.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These work great, and are really easy to set up and take down, light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Hexanna

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: These racks are amazing! I’ve used it 4 times, mostly with my paddle board but I even used them with a 3 person kayak. I haven’t gone more than 40, but it’s so easy to install and attach the board to, would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: N. DiBisceglie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great, light and durable! Perfect for my daughters surfboard.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

product_meta.title: Orion Motor Tech Lightweight Anti-Vibration Universal Car Soft Roof Rack Pad for Kayak/Canoe/Surfboard/Paddleboard/SUP/Snowboard and Water Sports Accessories with Adjustable and Substantial Straps
feature_bullets: Universal car fitment & adjustable, fit most of vehicles with or without gutters
With a heavy load capacity, the roof rack can hold luggage over 165.3lbs
Equipped with ultra-long straps & aircraft buckles to secure luggage, safety & strength guaranteed
Made of soft materials, vehicle scratching or scuffing can be avoided
Lightweight, anti-vibration & soft, accommodate various needs and conditions

specifications.Special Features:
📣 Do Not Use on the Plastic Bolt Point.
, ► Easy Installation and Anti Vibration
, 📣 Tuck in the Hoods, When Not Using Them.
, ► Money Back Guarantee
, ► No Roof Bars or Gutters Required
, ► Safe and Reliable
, ► Great for Who Enjoy Outdoor Life
, 📣 Make a Slip Knot When Using Rope to Join Both Ends.
, ► Universal Fit for All Kinds of Cars
, ► Heavy Duty Fabric with 1.5" Wide Strong Nylon Straps
, ► No More Hood Scratch from Straps and Buckles
, ★ 1-year warranty and response in 24 hours ★ Email ➤➤➤ support@orionmotortech.com
